EMACS:Â¶

Emacs is a cross platform, open-sourced (GPL) text editor that is easy to customize. With a few simple customizations included with Context, Emacs will create timestamps in your journal for you.

http://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/

Windows: http://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/windows/Getting-Emacs.html#Getting-Emacs http://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/emacs/windows/ http://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/emacs/windows/emacs-22.3-bin-i386.zip

Mac OS X: I personally use Carbon Emacs: http://homepage.mac.com/zenitani/emacs-e.html Aquamacs Emacs is another great option: http://aquamacs.org/

Ubuntu: Instructions for installing emacs on Ubuntu are also included in the system/startup.txt file and system/startup.sh script.

The code needed to customize Emacs to automatically create timestamps and new journal entries is included in: code/lisp/.emacs and code/lisp/.emacs.d

Specifically, the code to print journal stamps is available in: code/lisp/.emacs.d/journal.el

Link or copy these files to your home directory, or your C:drive in windows.

*2009.01.15 17:24:22 make that transition

m-x reload

m-x now

*2009.01.16 01:21:06 we have timestamps!
